title: Punjab (Establishment and Powers of Office of Inspection) Order, 2005
enacted_under: Regulation of Generation, Transmission and Distribution of Electric Power Act, 1997
summary: This Order establishes the Office of Inspection in Punjab to handle complaints related to electricity metering, billing, and tariff collection. It outlines the procedures for filing complaints, conducting investigations, and imposing penalties for violations.
source: Punjab__Punjab (Establishment and Powers of Office of Inspection) Order 2005.md

title: Punjab Abolition of Jagirs Act 1952
applicable_to: Landowners and Jagir holders in Punjab
summary: The Punjab Abolition of Jagirs Act, 1952 aims to abolish jagirs in Punjab, ceasing all non-military and non-charitable jagirs. It prohibits the creation of new jagirs and denies compensation claims related to abolished jagirs.

title: Punjab Acquisition of Land (Housing) (Repeal) (Amendment) Ordinance 2002
section_titles: Amendment of section 3 of Act XII of 1985
summary: This Ordinance amends the Punjab Acquisition of Land (Housing) (Repeal) Act, 1985 to update various provisions related to land acquisition. It aims to ensure clarity and efficiency in the implementation of land acquisition processes in Punjab.

title: Punjab (Establishment and Powers of Office of Inspection) Order, 2005
enacted_under: Regulation of Generation, Transmission and Distribution of Electric Power Act, 1997
applicable_to: Consumers and licensees in the electricity sector
summary: The Punjab (Establishment and Powers of Office of Inspection) Order, 2005 establishes the Office of Inspection to handle complaints related to electricity metering, billing, and penalties for violations. It outlines the procedures for filing complaints, conducting investigations, and issuing final orders.
source: Punjab__Punjab (Establishment and Powers of Office of Inspection) Order 2005.md

title: Punjab Abolition of Jagirs Act 1952
applicable_to: Landowners and Jagir holders in Punjab
summary: The Punjab Abolition of Jagirs Act, 1952 aims to abolish jagirs in the Punjab, ceasing all non-military jagirs and those not in favor of religious or charitable institutions. It also prohibits the creation of new jagirs and denies compensation claims related to the abolition.

title: Punjab Acquisition of Land (Housing) (Repeal) (Amendment) Ordinance 2002
section_titles: Amendment of section 3 of Act XII of 1985
summary: This Ordinance amends the Punjab Acquisition of Land (Housing) (Repeal) Act, 1985 to update certain provisions. It aims to clarify the roles of various officials involved in land acquisition and ensure the effective implementation of the Act.
